results.title: Screen Worlds opening : September 2009
results.brief_description:
On Thursday September 17, 2009 ACMI’s new permanent screen culture exhibition Screen Worlds, was officially launched. The red carpet, VIP event attracted world wide attention with the attendance of both internationally recognised and home grown guests and artists. Kicking off the formalities was ACMI’s Board President, John Thwaites, followed by ACMI Director Tony Sweeney, Oscar® Winning Actress Cate Blanchett, Victorian Arts Minister Lynne Kosky and Victorian Premier John Brumby.
Following this, the ribbon is cut and guests enter the exhibition for the first time.

results.title: Screen worlds : Interview with Ab Rogers
results.brief_description: British designer Ab Rogers is founder and head of a multi-disciplinary studio in London ARD (Ab Rogers Desgin). Ab visited ACMI in December 2008 and the Content Development crew interviewed him in relation to his design and intent behind the Screen Worlds exhibition. He spoke about the tendering process, the challenges of designing for the Federation Square space, his overall approach to design and a brief introduction to the three sections, Emergence, Voices and Sensation.

results.title: Setting the scene: virtual spaces (Roger Ford and Owen Paterson)
results.brief_description: A co-production between AFTRS and ACMI for ACMI’s Setting the Scene exhibition. Interviews with two Australian production designers with a focus on creating virtual worlds. Roger Ford talks about the role of a production designer on a production and his experience of creating computer-designed sets from Babe to The Chronicles of Narnia : Prince Caspian. Owen Paterson discusses his work on Speed Racer and the Matrix and creating digital worlds.

results.title: Setting the scene: landscape spaces (Chris Kennedy and Stephen Curtis)
results.brief_description: Interviews with Chris Kennedy and Stephen Curtis, Australian production designers on their work. Chris Kennedy talks about the two different approaches he took for two films, the building of a town in The Proposition and finding already existing locations for The Road. Stephen Curtis talks about his approach to production designing on his work on Bedevil and Night Cries. Prodcued by AFTRS and ACMI for ACMI’s Setting the Scene exhibition.
